creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: loose line drawing of a man sitting in a rocking chair; rocking chair faces to the left of the picture plane
inscription:
-- in graphite on recto, bottom edge: 2381 Torson
-- in graphite on verso, bottom right: Torson | #48 | WH SILK | D34
-- stamp on verso, upper left: 366
-- stamped on mount and frame: 2381
provenance: [John A. Torson, New York; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Man in a Rocking Chair
